Culture and Patronage
Kanishka

The greatest Kushan ruler; initiated the Saka Era in 78 CE. He convened the Fourth Buddhist Council in Kashmir, where Buddhism was divided into Hinayana and Mahayana. He was a great patron of the Gandhara and Mathura art schools. Scholars like Ashvaghosha, Nagarjuna, and Charaka adorned his court.
